availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S. Middelton (Shelby County, Kentucky, student and soldier)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Missouri native. Married to Rebecca J. Bennett Middleton in Oldham County, Kentucky, on November 1, 1864. Resident of Shelby County in 1860. Mustered into the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) on September 23, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 2, p. 53.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Oldham County Marriages, Film 000482451.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 974.
"James S. Middleton (1843-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial 46218649, accessed October 11, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46218649.
